alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 06 at 2:55AM MST until January 06 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 3 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations 2 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Boulder and the western suburbs of Denver, Denver, Greeley, and Byers. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Winter Weather Advisory will expire due to decreasing snow bands and snowfall rates. Light snow will continue through early morning Thursday.
